meanings.definition: To subject (seeds or plants) to a period of cold in order to induce flowering.
meanings.sent1: I vernalize my flower seeds by placing them in the refrigerator.
meanings.sent2: Farmers vernalize certain crops to ensure they bloom at the right time.
meanings.sent3: The seeds decided to vernalize in the chilly fridge for a flowery surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her heart vernalized with joy, blooming like a winter flower.
meanings.sent5: The cold touch of vernalization awakened the dormant seeds, painting the garden in colors.
